contentrichtext.text: During the [[Spanish-American war]] of 1898, '''Cámara's Flying Relief Column''' was a [[navy|naval]] [[task force]] of [[Spain]]'s most powerful [[warship]]s, under the command of [[Rear Admiral]] [[Manuel de la Cámara]], to relieve Spanish forces in [[Manila]] after the defeat of Spanish Pacific Squadron under [[Admiral]] [[Patricio Montojo y Pasarón]] by the [[United States|American]] [[Asiatic Squadron]] under [[Commodore (USN)|Commodore]] [[George Dewey]] in the [[Battle of Manila Bay]] on May 1, 1898. The Spanish fleet, consisting of the [[Spanish battleship Pelayo]], the [[armoured cruiser]] ''Carlos V'' and four other warships, left Spain in June 1898. The squadron was far more powerful than that commanded by Dewey.<ref name=keenan2001p274 /><ref name=durand2009p65 /> The [[monitor (warship)|monitor]] [[USS Monterey (BM-6)]] had been ordered from the U.S. to the Philippines, and departed on 11 June. The U.S. moved to detach the [[battleship]]s [[USS Iowa (BB-4)|Iowa]] and [[USS Oregon (BB-3)|Oregon]] and the [[cruiser]] [[USS Brooklyn (CA-3)|USS Brooklyn]] from the squadron then blockading Cuba for raids and bombardment of Spanish ports On 7 July, Spain ordered Cámara's fleet to return home, and the American ships never left the [[Caribbean]].<ref name=keenan2001p274>{{cite book|author=Jerry Keenan|title=Encyclopedia of the Spanish-American & Philippine-American Wars|url=http://books.google.com/books?id=JMRwK4ng_zYC|year=2001|publisher=ABC-CLIO|isbn=978-1-57607-093-2|pages=[http://books.google.com.ph/books?id=JMRwK4ng_zYC&pg=PA274 274]}}</ref><ref name=durand2009p65>{{cite book|author=John Durand|title=The Boys: 1st North Dakota Volunteers in the Philippines|url=http://books.google.com/books?id=_SmzBvedBrEC|year=2009|publisher=Puzzlebox Press|isbn=978-0-9743783-3-6|pages=[http://books.google.com.ph/books?id=_SmzBvedBrEC&pg=PA65 65]}}</ref><ref>{{cite book|author1=Michael Golay|author2=John Stewart Bowman|title=Spanish-American War|url=http://books.google.com/books?id=tp_7mH5QEugC|year=2003|publisher=Infobase Publishing|isbn=978-0-8160-4935-6|pages=[http://books.google.com.ph/books?id=tp_7mH5QEugC&pg=PA68 68]}}</ref> ==References== {{reflist}} ==Further reading== *{{cite book|author=Albert A. Nofi|title=The Spanish-American War, 1898|url=http://books.google.com/books?id=tsqWQAAACAAJ|year=1996|publisher=Combined Books|isbn=978-0-938289-57-9}} ==External links== *[http://www.spanamwar.com The Spanish-American War Centennial Website] {{DEFAULTSORT:Camara's Flying Relief Column}} [[Category:Military units and formations of the Spanish–American War]] {{navy-stub}}
